Reviews.Title: “Worth to stay”
Reviews.Author: GMBAIG
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel perhaps appartment to stay with family, every thing is available within your room (to eat, to cook, to wash, to iron & etc.). near to bur dubai shopping area (mina bazar or adjacent market) and metro station. if you want to stay in bur dubai area then it is excellent place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bargain!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia032
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Al Rolla street about 10 minutes walking (about 700m) of the Al Fahidi Metro station (green line), and close to Mina Bazar area in Dubai Creek. If you are coming from the airport you can take the metro at the airport for 4.50 Dirham and change to the green line in Union Square Station. The whole trip will take about 15 minutes. The hotel is an apart hotel by Le Meridien, this means the aparts are only run by Le Meridien , if you want the 5 star comfort of Le Meridien for the apart rates you need a reality check. The apart has a 4* rate for an apartment and although is getting a bit dated is fine. The room is big airy, and consist of a king size bed, a sitting area with a 40 inches flat screen TV. A kitchenette area with an eating bar and chairs, a couple of hoves , microwave, washing machine, fridge, kettle, toaster, and basic pots and pans as well as crockery. Every day they supply you with tea and coffee as well as 2 bottles of water. The bathroom has a bath with an overhead shower and. Is a decent size and provides all the toiletries included proper conditioner besides the normal shampoo and shower gel. I mention this because in all my travels around the world, and having stayed in 5 stars hotels this is the first time that I have a separate conditioning and shampoo. The property is immaculate clean. My room was overlooking the busy road and had a balcony. I did not hear any traffic noise, except for the call to pray. The balcony had a portable washing line, and inside the wardrobe there was an iron board and an iron. The Apart hotel looks exactly as the pictures, has a medium side swimming pool in the roof terrace, with lounges that come with mattresses and they provide courtesy towels. There is a gym a sauna and steam room. There is a business centre in the lobby with 3 computers that you can use free of charge for 45 minutes at a time. Should you need to print anything the only computer connected with the printer is the one in the middle. Around the hotel there are many shopping mall and supermarkets. I found the best one just next door to the hotel, and you can visit the historic places and the creek which is only 10 minutes walk. Please do not confuse with the Creek green line station from the metro. This creek is where you can take the abra boats (120 dirham), or better and cheaper the new air conditioned Dubai ferry (50 dirham) to do a 1 hour cruise around Dubai coast line, including the harbour and Burj Al Arab. The other route cost the same and leaves from the Marina and takes you to Jumeirah and the Palm Island. To summarize the hotel is a very good value for money; the staff is very friendly and efficient. I could not find any post office to send some post cards, the concierge charge me only for the price of the stamps and sent a card to the post office. Even better that the post cards just arrived to the UK.! , the location is great to discover the real Dubai and is very safe, I was a woman on my own and even I walked to the metro at 5:30 in the morning to go to the airport to catch my flight back. When I will be returning to Dubai I will definitely book again Dar Al Sondos apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Not good service”
Reviews.Author: altawi k
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before ,i was happy by my last stay,but now hotel has stop caring about the guest,Anyways this was my last stay.Hotel surely needs improvement.Staffs are good,helpfull.Great location,just misbehiave by Receptionist the Arabic lady. She Need help.

Reviews.Title: “al sondos apartments le meridien - great location by blr”
Reviews.Author: blrblr
Reviews.Content: just like the previous poster, we also booked a secret hotel through lastminute and got this hotel. even we were worried after reading some reviews about what we would have to expect. But everything turned out fine. The most important thing was the location for us. And i believe it cant be better than this. The hotel is situated in Deira, the old city of Dubai. (nice and safe area) The entrance to metro station is just in front of hotel !! The red line takes in short time to the airport and to the main tourist attractions! Just across the the street is the Deira City Centre Mall. You get there anything you need till late night. (food court, supermarket, shopping, etc) There are lot of restaurants and other dining options around the hotel. The rooms are big and clean. You got everything you need. There is small kitchen (cooking unit, micro oven, dishes, etc). A sitting area with sofa. And most important a very nice and clean bathroom. The staff is really friendly and helping. They will put a baby cot inside the room, when asked. The only minor minus is that there is no wifi in the rooms. (but there is a business center which you can use free of charge) Please dont confuse it with a Le Merdien Hotel and dont compare to that sort of standards. It is what it is: APARTMENTS by Le Meridien not hotel. I dont think you will find such a nice place with prime location to stay in Dubai at these prices, especially not during peak season (Dubai shopping festival, February) I am quite sure that next time i am in Dubai, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further!”
Reviews.Author: solodrifter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was much better than I expected. It's in a good location and the price is outstanding. You WILL NOT find a better hotel at this price! In my opinion, it is a 5 star hotel at a budget minded travellers price. the location is great; there are a few eateries and a full Supermarket in walking distance. Although the train station and mall are in walking distance, it is a bit further. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean. Overall, look no further because you will be satisfied with your selection.

Reviews.Title: “5* location, 5* facilities, 5* service, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LauraIngalls
Reviews.Content: First tip, I found this as a "top secret bargain" hotel on lastminute.com, and what a truth! We paid little more for our suites than what 2* Premier Inn charged for its suburb locale. But al Sandos is very central; it is only 2 stops by Metro rail from the airport, literally behind the train station. Cross the road, and you enter Deira City Center mall, whic in itself is good. Plus the Dubai buses serve the Deira central frequently. This makes the location perfect for exploring all of Dubai, not merely its beaches. As for the hotel, it is an all suite hotel, thus rooms come with a seating area, kitchenette & sizeable bathroom (with bidet, spray & loo roll, depending on preference). The bath has a shower, so that is all covered, too. The swimming pool in the hotel is decent size, with an indulgent jaccuzzi there, too. Free Wi Fi makes another bonus, though it is only free in the lobby restaurant; printing is possible free of charge in the business center. All in all, this was an indulgent location for holiday or honeymoon, with plenty to accommodate business travellers, too. Most definitely top of my list for a Dubai return.

Reviews.Title: “good affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: abhishekmehra
Reviews.Content: this is a good affordable hotel with good staff. the restaurant is not very good but lot of places around, this property is located in the bur dubai area which is the older part of town. for those seeking a more new look dubai go for JBR area.

Reviews.Title: “What are you complaining about? Can you find a cheaper hotel in Dubai?”
Reviews.Author: GlobalExplorator
Reviews.Content: Try to find a hotel for under $150 (high season) / $100 (low season) in Dubai and you'll end up at some rather seedy establishments fit for the kind of men who just rolled in with a barrel of rum from many months on the high seas and the kind of women who . . . well, you get the point. Dar Al Sondos is not looking to compete with the likes of the Burj al Arab, The Address, Hyatt Regency or other $500+ / night establishments and people who rock up with expectations far in excess of what they have paid will be reality checked accordingly. However, in many, many more stays at DAS over the past few years than I can be bothered count at DAS, I have never had any real problems whatsoever. The rooms have been consistently clean, the furniture consistently modern, the front desk check-in and -out consistently efficient and courteous (even advising me to book on the Starwoods website in future so that I could save money on the room rate), and my experience consistently positive. There are no other hotels in Dubai that I can speak of that I can say that about (and I have stayed at a lot), which is why I keep returning. If you want to live the high life, look elsewhere, but if you want value for money, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient....But....”
Reviews.Author: Mihyar
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Sondos suites with good overall experience, the great things about this hotel is: Location, 1 minutes walk to metro station, 3 minutes walk to City center mall.. that is the best thing about it, very spacious room with fully equipped kitchenette, very comfortable king size bed, friendly staff with easy check in and out procedure. However there are some thing that really should be a concern to the management, the rooms are getting old and need some maintenance, carpets look old (removing them out should do) if they do not want to replace with new, windows need urgent maintenance as they do not shut properly thus you can hear the noisy street trafic, which is really unpleasant, I complaint to the front desk but nothing happened. If the above issues are solved I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: businessTraveller301
Reviews.Content: This property and the staff are a first class operation. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The location is superb, the hotel is extremely clean, great rooms/suites, very nice restaurant. I would definitely stay again. They should provide wireless internet and not the wired kind.

Reviews.Title: “Way below Le Meridien avarage”
Reviews.Author: dariotime
Reviews.Content: Even if I had a good price (450 Dirham) my stay at Al Sondos Hotel Apartments, I was quite disappointed. I arrived very late and as Platinum Member I haven't had anything except the free internet connection. No club lounge, no upgrade. The room wasn't at the normal Le Meridien and Starwood brands quality with very old furnitures and crumbling bathroom. I also found a dirty towel! I was very surprised to find an hotel of Le Meridien brand, but not at Le Meridien quality.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RahulMenon
Reviews.Content: Full furnish Condos great for a couple to enjoy stay peacefully and enjoy Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Old Dubai”
Reviews.Author: annakf26
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at Dar Al Sondos in Bur Dubai. If you are looking for a touristy luxury hotel and want to be close to the new skyscrapers, etc. this hotel is not for you. I always prefer the old, more historic/cultural parts of a city, so this hotel was exactly what I was looking for. I was one of the few tourists walking around Bur Dubai (especially in early morning and evening), so you get to see a glimpse of real Dubai life you won't get in the newer parts. I am a 25 year old female and was traveling alone, and I felt completely comfortable and safe walking around alone (even at night). I didn't get any of the unwelcome attention that's sometimes typical of the less touristy parts of big cities. The staff at the hotel were extremely welcoming, helpful and kind throughout my stay, and my room was clean, spacious and very comfortable. I also thought it was a very unique, cool experience to hear the call to prayer before sunrise every morning over the mosque tower speakers. This hotel is the perfect jumping off point to explore Bur Dubai souqs, Dubai Creek and Deira, as well as a short walk to the Metro to go down to new Dubai. Also, if you're a SPG member, this hotel is a great value for points - I paid 7,000 pts for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: Euan O
Reviews.Content: Although I got a relatively good rate on my stay at the Dar Al Sondos Hotel Apartments, I was disappointed with the overall experience. I found that the hotel does a disservice to the Le Meridien and Starwood brands and quality is not competitive with other Dubai hotels that have similar standard rates. Overall, the hotel comes across as undistinguished from the budget end of the Bur Dubai/Deira market (i.e. non-brand, low-cost). However, when you are look at this hotel at its usual rates and with the expectations of an established chain then you may be disappointed. Despite having pre-booked my room and prepaid the stay in full to ensure my preferences would be available for a late evening check-in, when I arrived no non-smoking rooms were available. The check-in clerk then tried to offload a twin double-bed room instead of a king (clearly not a benefit when travelling solo). My keycards also expired (without warning) after only two nights - an unnecessary inconvenience. Although I had not asked to extend my stay, on the morning of my scheduled check-out, I found a note stuck in the door telling me that I could not stay as they had overbooked. So I did not find the service welcoming. The room was spacious enough and with plenty of natural light (windows on two sides), but with an odd, apparently unplanned, layout - half a dozen different sets of light switches scattered around the room, some unconnected, another with wires protruding, and neither of the bed-side lamps had working switches. Insulation was less than is typical for buildings (particularly hotels) in Dubai - the room was warm when I arrived, despite the relatively moderate outdoor temperatures in January, so I would worry about how it would cope later in the year. The thermostat was also showing a "low battery" indicator. The other effect of the limited insulation was the noise levels - I was woken regularly by traffic. Similarly, you can hear every word of the calls to prayer from the mosque down the road, whether you want to wake up at dawn or not. When not bring woken by the ambient noise, the hotel's fire alarm went off intermittently throughout one of the three nights I stayed there. As a studio suite, there was a two-ring electric stove and microwave, one set of tableware and a few utensils (with some missing). Similarly, an ironing board was provided but the iron was missing. In the bathroom, the toilet flush mechanism was broken (although they did try to fix this, it fell apart again within a day). The room showed signs of having been hastily cleaned, with some dirty mop marks on the floor. On the positive side, despite being a smoking room, there was no obvious odour. The hotel is located within walking distance (about 600m) of the newly-opened Metro green line and a similar distance from the historic sites. There are numerous supermarkets nearby and it makes sense to either shop there and cook in the room, or to go out to eat. The hotel offers food and other supplementary services (internet, etc.) at Le Meridien rates, but not at Le Meridien quality. In terms of facilities, there are three PCs in the lobby "business centre", of which two were functional during my stay, albeit with time limits on their usage. The printer was not working. The gymnasium and pool are standard fare - a few pieces of equipment and a small pool, but on the plus side the gym is open 24-hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Not a starwood property!”
Reviews.Author: jatintar
Reviews.Content: This does not befit a starwood property at all. We stayed here for 6 nights. Also BEWARE of checking in early as there is a 100 Dhiram extra charge for coming before 3 pm. There is also an extra charge of 275 Dhirams for checking out late but this extra charge allows you to stay till 7 pm. 1) Rooms: The rooms are very average with stained floors. The rooms need renovation very badly and the bedding needs to be replaced along with the linen. The flooring is vitrified/ ceramic tiles and you can hear noises from upper floors. 2) Room service and cleaning service: Very poor. The coffee shop that provides you the breakfast service has only one attendant on duty in the evening. If that attendant is serving some room there is no one to pick up your phone for the order. The room cleaning service is good but the minute you ask something after your room is cleaned you will have to wait hours. We asked for a couple of tissue boxes as the cleaning service had not replaced the finished boxes and have waited for hours and hours to get this. 3) Breakfast: Breakfast is average with salad, fruits, some Indian dishes along with bacon and sausages. Sometimes baked beans are given and generally speaking there are about 6 dishes in all other than salad and fruits. 4) Reception: The people are quite friendly and moderately polite. Overall, I would say that this is NOT A STARWOOD HOTEL. For anyone who has stayed in a level 3 starwood hotel and above should avoid staying here. The reason is that over time we have started to expect a very high quality of things from starwood hotels and people will be quite dissappointed to see that this hotel is not upto a starwood standard hotel at all. The Le Meridien tag should be removed from this hotel and it should be run independantly. I do have photos which I will upload later.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Skx7430
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and can accommodate two adults, for 100 AED you can get a roll away. Do not eat at the hotel, walk outside and you can eat local food for less than half price. Taxis are readily available, this hotel is in Bur Dubai so you will be staying in the non glitzy Dubai. But a short walk to metro will give you access to all of touristy destinations. Staff is very friendly. This is dry hotel so has no liquor liscence, but you cam walk to couple of properties which have bars.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, excellent and caring staff”
Reviews.Author: Neelomi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel toward the end of Feb 2011 for 7 nights with my mom and aunt-uncle. We were booked in 2 adjoining apartments on the fourth floor. The apartments were spacious, comfortable, clean, and modern; the kitchenette had everything you'd expect and need to cook your own meal (only thing I found missing was a sharp knife to cut fruits and so on). The double bed was soft and cozy enough for a good night's sleep. The apartment has an iron and ironing board. The TV had some 30 odd channels (mostly international but not too many in English). The bathroom was modern and clean, and toiletries were supplied regularly. Our balcony faced the main road and looked into a residential-seeming building on the opposite side. There's a mosque very close to the hotel, so if you're a light sleeper, you might wake up with the prayer call at 5.30 am on the loudspeaker. The breakfast spread had a good variety, from the usual toast, cereal, juices, fruit, eggs, jams, to some Indian items as well, because a lot of guests are Indians. The hotel is located on Al Rolla street, about 10 mins walking from the famous Mina Bazaar area on one side and the Dubai creek part from where you'd get an abra to go to old Dubai. It's a bit of a walk to get to the main road but the walk is safe even at night. As someone else mentioned, getting a taxi may sometimes be a problem. But we never had to wait too long to find one. The staff was especially friendly and caring; on the 3rd day of my trip, I had an accident and had to receive 7 stitches on my face; the staff always enquired about my health on the remaining days of the trip; check-in and check-out were smooth. I did not use the hotel wi-fi but they have 2 computers in the lobby, which you can use free of cost for a 30 min session (it logs you out automatically after 30 mins). Overall, a wonderful hotel with polite and friendly staff. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “good one for economical stay”
Reviews.Author: ishan1988
Reviews.Content: I had a stay from my company to this dar al sondos by le meridien , i think the name is enough to describe how good it is . very nice hotel with a very clean and tidy room and near the market where everything is available nearby like supermarkets, restaurants and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good access to the Creek & Old Dubai”
Reviews.Author: RMS1974
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had to book an extra night in Dubai on short notice. I chose Dar Al Sondos because I knew it and it has everything you need for a day/night stopover. The rooms are large and clean. They are also very well furnished with two large beds, dining area, small kitchenette with a microwave and twin hobs, washing machine & fridge. We booked a room on the execuitve floor, which gave us access to the business lounge (complimentary snacks & drinks, continental breakfast). There is a swimming pool on the roof with excellent views of the sky scrapers on Sheik Zhayed Road. The pool is open till very late. The restuarant downstairs does a pretty good breakfast as well. There is a good supermarket next door and you are about a fifteen minute stroll from the Creek and the abra stations. The service is pretty good - it is not the smoothest in Dubai, but this hotel is not the most expensive either! The staff are always friendly and polite. Amazingly, they recognised me from my last stay. This hotel is dry - if you want alcohol and parties then you will need to go elsewhere. The only downside to this hotel is that getting a taxi can be tricky sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel... confused , annoying staff..”
Reviews.Author: irish-mumbai
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during vacation, with wife and two kids, apartment size is pretty decent, neat bathroom, toilet accessories always missing, have to call everytime for soap towels and other toileteries. I booked this from mumbai for 5 nights 10 nov to 15 nov, on 12 I got a notice from conceirge that you will have to check out on 12th, I went down to reception and handed over booking vouchers. However it was bugging to receive another notice on the door to check-out on 13th due to which I had heated arguements with the lobby manager, later resolved.. buffet breakfast was typically same every morning but ok.. in short Le-Meridians Dar al Sandos is a decent apartment suites with confused and annoying staff.. Location wise good.. Suitable for Families and holidayers...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilyas k
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel couple of time. very good hotel with big rooms, neat and clean environment, all accessories including kitchen and laundry within the room. Internet charges are high though.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for families in Bur Dubai Area”
Reviews.Author: rsoodmail
Reviews.Content: We stayed in studio apartment during eid holidays. Booked room over net. If you are sure of your dates than you should opt for non-refundable options as you get very reasonable rates. The hotel is situated in Rolla street in heart of Bur Dubai area. Restaurants, Metro station & bus stand are very close to this. Service is very good. Internet availability is on payment and thru cable ( No WI-FI). 2 Pool PC for surfing internet are provided at Ground floor free of cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SusanSingapore2010
Reviews.Content: This was a nice little suite, not far from the airport and the metro was literally at the doorstep of the hotel. Across the street was Deira City centre a big mall with shops, cinema and large choice of eateries. This was open late and road crossing was easy enough. They offer airport transfers, but you have to pay extra for it. Business centre available with wi-fi and printer. Reception staff were very nice and helpfull too.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place good for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: Foddiiii
Reviews.Content: Staff is very helpful, Room were spacious and the hotel location is very good

Reviews.Title: “It's oh kay”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: Staff is very good. Room is pretty clean, not perfect but pretty clean. Bedding and mattress are horrible. Literally, these are the worst pillows at a hotel of this type I have ever stayed at. Mattress is really bad. I was in so much pain after sleeping on it. And the bedding is pretty bad as well. It is oh kay for one nite. About 10-15 minute walk from Al Fahidi train stop. So if you are a walker like myself, you can easily get there to and from the airport and other sites around town. Breakfast is oh kay and the neighborhood is oh kay too. This is definitely not the glitzy and glamorous part of Dubai. I like to see different parts of cities, but if you are coming to Dubai, there are places at similar prices closer to the Vegas-like parts of the city. (Ibis near Mall of the Emirates is similar price) You will get treated well by the staff but not sure it is worth that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for short or long term..”
Reviews.Author: happylifeforme
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very Pleasant at the Dar Al Sondos. We were traveling with an infant and had no problems in the hotel. Infact the staff is quite helpful and made sure that we were comfortable. The food in the coffee shop was nice. It is definitely one of the good places to stay while in Dubai. The location is quite central as well ... Thanks to everyone there who made our stay comfortable..

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice good value!”
Reviews.Author: Pauline N
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stop-over on our way to the UK & Europ to break our journey. The hotel was excellent value, beautiful large room & bathroom well furnished with pleasing decor. Breakfast was not included in the room rate but at $20 it exceeded our expectations with a huge variety of everything imaginable to eat, well worth the extra cost. A roof top pool was small but it was refreshing as the afternoon cooled down. A memorable stay in Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Starwoods/Le Meridien stay yet”
Reviews.Author: Bookend48
Reviews.Content: After many great stays at the Dar Al Sondos this stay was very disappointing. Changed the first room (518) , second room (719), again on an 'executive' floor, proved to be poorly maintained resulting in loss of sleep for two nights. Sunday night noise coming from bathroom/hallway every few seconds. Sounds like pigeons nesting in the roof space. Turn air-con off and hot water off and bang around area ceiling no change. Noise same throughout the night. Try to report first thing in morning, seems like phone system diverted. Went down to reception and report. To their credit within 10 minutes Maintenance guy attends says it air-con problem (I try to explain it happens when Air-con is switched off. They advise problem will be fixed after 9am. Meanwhile second guy comes to the room hears the noise and says its pigeons nesting. I returned to the hotel late that evening and reception confirm problem fixed 'all ok'. I ask what problem was – 'don't know sir'. No sign of any ceiling tiles etc having been removed. Have doubts anyone came during the day. Throughout the night same problem and no sleep. Next morning I go down and get Duty manager. Maintenance guys work on the problem and strip down the hot-water system. Engineers very helpful. Noise now only slight. I ask what was done the day before 'not sure', probably code for nothing! At last a night's sleep. Thus far (5 days) no one from hotel bothered to check with me if all now working ok or offer any kind of gesture/apology. Wrote email complaint. After couple of days I catch Duty Manager and ask if he got my email (sent to email address as per business card) 'no I've not seen it. Send me copy to xxxx email address'. Copy email duly sent and rejected by Starwood's web-host as address doesn’t exist. No response to copy sent to 'Reservations'. I had been due to have checked out earlier but extended my stay (at higher cost due too late notice) in order to catch-up on some sleep. Maybe there was a hope I'd just check-out and ignore the inconvenience. Handed hotel reception staff a further copy of my complaint at check-out. Kettle didn't work, toaster didn't work (2 days to replace it), slippers two days to supply, electric shock from the Iron, wc so loud surprised other guests didn't complain, cracked floor tiles around pool, asked reception for sharp knife and sewing kit said would send. Never arrived. None of these items in isolation matter but combined, and on the back of 2 nights lost sleep, give the impression of quickly declining standards. So much so I asked staff if the hotel was being closed down as it seems to have been run down past few months. Even in these tight financial times still a need to maintain assets if keeping the chain is keeping the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: RMS1974
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel on three occasions when travelling with friends and have found it to be good value for money, especially if all you want is somewhere to sleep and maybe lie by the pool for a couple of hours. If you want views and a resort, you need to go elsewhere (and spend a lot more money!). The rooms are clean and spacious with enough space for three people (two queen size beds and one single) plus room for seating, TV, desk and kitchen area. The bathrooms are clean and well maintained. The hotel is dry (no alcohol licence) and the restaurant menu is limited, but still good value. There is a swimming pool on the roof which never seems to be crowded. The pool area is clean and well serviced. The views of the city from here are great, especially at night when you can see the modern skyscrapers on Sheik Zayhed Road all lit up. Whenever we have stayed here we have booked rooms on the business club floors which gives us access to the business lounge area and includes breakfast and complimentary snacks & drinks during the day. The business lounge also has a couple of PCs that you can use to access the internet. The business lounge is on the floor just below the swimming pool, so getting snacks & drinks while sunbathing is easy! There is a small gym with weights and a few machines, but we have never used it. It looks like it is well maintained. The staff are generally polite and helpful, but do not kid yourself that you are staying in a five star resort; they are not going to be able to organis a tourist itinerary for you! Wifi, like in most hotels in Dubai, is extra and slow. The location is not great - there are some local restaurants nearby and a supermarket, but that is about it. However, it only a fifteen minute walk through old Dubai to the Creek. The shops between the hotel and the Creek can be great for bargain hunting. If you want to go drinking and partying you will need to get a taxi. Sometimes, getting a taxi from the hotel can be a bit of a problem as the hotel is off the main streets. I would recommend this hotel as a great low-cost option or for people who dont want to stay in a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Rudeness of Yaseen”
Reviews.Author: Unknown U
Reviews.Content: To Whom it may concern I would like to bring to your attention about the attitude of one of your staff, as he is a title holder as Supervisor. I had very bad experience to your people, your hotel is so dirty and your staff is so RUDE. Arrive in the hotel at around 11:00 am in the morning, and no body at your reception. I waited for more than 15 mins, some of the staff texting, till Mr. Yaseen attended me to check in, but he so RUDE I ask him if he can help me to find a good place to go have sightseeing for my short stay, instead he just look at me and say nothing, and even he did not ask me my purpose of my visit, if this is my first time to visit in dubai, he just look at me and ask my credit card, I give my credit card and he came back to me saying "do you cash as your credit card is not working, or otherwise i will not give you room or check in without any credit card as he said that its the standard of the hotel. " I give him a cash, and i ask him if he can give me a good room and good view and a non smoking room, instead he said "all rooms is the same" and " we don't have non smoking room available, you want to take it or no?" I politely accept the card key from him, and he never ask from his colleague to help me up my luggages. You have so bad rooms and so rude staff. I dont know why you keeping this such of staff does'nt know how to place the guest, and he was asking like he is the owner of the hotel. Is your hotel has proper training for your front liner staff? As i believe at this hotel is one of the Starwood hotels. I stayed so many hotels around the world but I had never encounter service like this. UN FRIENDLY STAFF LOUSY STAFF, RUDE STAFF

Reviews.Title: “"Considered to be our Second Home"”
Reviews.Author: daddooo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great! We used to stay on this hotel always because the staff are good! Especially Ariel, Surekcha (the Nepali Lady) and Aisha. They know how to deal with guest. The management should take good care of this kind of associates! Thumbs up with you guys! The location, room was also good! There's a nearby supermarket also where you can buy your stuffs. The only negative is with the reservation, I don't know what is the name, but I think "MAHMOUD"..something like that...he is very rude! If I will make my reservation again I don't want to talk with this guy again! Seriously!!! Above all of this, we loved this hotel and considered to be our second home! Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: sammydeshammy
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through the sheraton hotels own website.it cost me £30 including taxes per night without breakfas.t must be the cheapest 3/4 star in dubai.the rooms were cleanand nicely fitted out.the water pressure in the bathrooms was poor admittily.overall .my son hurt his foot over there and the staff bent over backwards to help him.they even supplied him with a wheelchair.my only main complaint was the swimming pool which had dirty,greasy tiles at the deep end. i travel to dubai once ayear,and have stayed in various hotels this is the best value hotel in dubai.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR THE BUDGET TRAVELLER.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price Deal. They are good in promises too but never show”
Reviews.Author: bbears2118
Reviews.Content: me and my partner planned to celebrate out 2nd year anniversary in this hotel. On reservations we requested for an early check in and non smoking room. We have emailed the hotel as well that we will be celebrating our anniversary and they promised to give us s good room and a fruit basket. We arrived at 13:00hrs we were surprised we were given a smoking room. When we came to the room the AC was not working for more than 1hour. it was rectified. the next day, exactly the same time the AC was not working again. We called and inform the concern but we waited for more than one hour and still nobody came to rectify, hence we called the operator again. Seems like they set a timer for the AC. It shuts down during the hot and humid time of the day. Until we checked out we never received th fruit basket that they promised. The should not say such promises if they cannot show it to the guest. We expected a lot on this hotel but our expectations failed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: ademarco6
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel for the location close to City Centre Mall and also the Dubai airport. It is maybe 10-15 minutes from the airport depending on trafiic and the cab ride is usually 30-40 dirham. The check-in is good and they offer you juice. I was even offered a cold towel to wipe my face from the perspiration on the second visit. They gave me a 1 bedroom suite and it had 2 bathrooms and 2 tvs, 1 flatscreen in the living room and 1 tube tv in the bedroom. They have a toaster, washing machine, fridge, and stove, but I never really used the features as this place was a transit hotel for me for my layovers in Dubai. It is very clean and the steak sandwich in the restaurant was great. The restaurant is the only place with free wi-fi, but if you want it in the room, then you have to pay 79 dirham. Kind of expensive to use for 1 day. The wake up calls were always on time and they called twice to ensure you wake up. The city centre mall is close, but you have to cross a 6 lane intersection. The second time I stayed it sounded like someone was bouncing a ball on the floor above me and I called them to check it out. They reported that they didn't find anything, but it kept going on. I guess it must be some kid on the top floor that decided to bounce a ball at 1AM. I just put in my ear plugs and went to sleep. They have a decent gym and pool, but didn't have time to use them. They also provided a fruit basket for me on my second stay. Not sure if this was because I am an SPG Gold or if they do that for every guest. Overall a great deal for the location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: aggarwal_ritesh
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in April 2011. It is a small hotel with decent rooms and service. The best thing is a small kichenette that is available in most of the rooms. So, one can plan long stays and do some cooking if required. The room size is quite good and consists of dinning area, drawing area and beds. The service is also decent. It is situated very close to the city center and it hardly takes 10 mins to reach most of the famous sight seeing and malls around. All in all a very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Musqat
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night recently and was very impressed. The room was very large and well appointed. It had a sitting area, sleeping area and a well-equipped kitchen. My room was at the back and overlooked an empty lot, making it very quiet. There is a small gym and a fair-size roof-top pool. The price includes a decent breakfast. The staff is friendly and professional. Best of all, the rate was Dh 238 ( $65) including tax.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru080
Reviews.Content: This apartment hatel has been my favorite for quite some time. i frequently visit Dubai on business and this property offers great value for the money spent and the added advantage of having a fully functional kitchen/washing machine/ironing board etc ...makes great sense if you have to spend long periods of time. Have used their facility when on vacation with family too. Of late I see that their superior standards have dropped a bit and their new set of staff are quite untrained in customer service. Some of the fixtures need refurbishment...even then I would say a good neat economic place to stay at within walking distance of the electronic/gold/textile market.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at Le Meridian”
Reviews.Author: rahul90006
Reviews.Content: My Stay at Le Meridian was great. I enjoyed my time there. The food was great and you can get a varities of food avilable with them. Ambiance of rooms are awesome and service is number one here There are lot of things you can do in the hotel as i was running out of time so was unable to enjoy

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a DUMP........................”
Reviews.Author: emmaclara
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump, the room needed to painted, all the furnishings were outdated the bathroom tile floor was cracked, bath tub was cracked and the caulking was rusting and pealing, shower curtain was covered in something black appeared to be mold, shower water presure was very low. The kitchen microwave and toasted was outdated and dirty, the refrig needed defrosting. Bed linen and bath towels were not white, the towels were old and had holes, they were NOT white, soft or fluffy. The towels were like the ones I would use to clean and wash my car. The patio windows were dirty. It is in an area that is populated by Indians and they made noise all night, resembled the ghetto.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value In Dubai But no WIFI ! Comon Le Meridian buy a $20 router for gods sake”
Reviews.Author: TripReviewer2012
Reviews.Content: Outstanding value in a great working class neighborhood in Dubai. We paid AED200 for an outstanding room. The room was clean. The service was impeccable and we were met with gracious and kind service. The hotel itself is in a little disrepair but for about $50 a night in Dubai, we weren't complaining. Decent breakfast, clean gym and pool. The only draw back was NO WIFI! Not even a WIFI connection in the lobby. They try to charge you AED100 for a wired internet connection in your room so we went down the street to the RAMDEE hotel to check our emails on our ipads. Overall I would stay here again for sure. You just can't find deals like this in Dubai. however,Dear, Le Meridian ($5 billion dollar chain) please buy a $20 wifi router for your Dubai hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, 100% satisfaction :-)”
Reviews.Author: BEA111111111
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Emirates for six days, three in Hilton Ras al Khaimah, and three here. I have paid about 40 Euro per night for a really big apartment, it could be at least 35 - 40 square meters. Nice furniture, the bed was better than I´ve got home :-) There was a kitchen corner wih dishes, microwave, washing mashine, hob, kettle with free teas and coffes - just everything you could need. Bathroom basic, but nice and clean. They have their own private parking behind the hotel, which was free (I rented a car), so that´s a really good point. The staf was very friendly and helpful. They have 2 computers with free internet access at the reception, the wired internet in the room was about 90 DHS. I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ulfj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at Al Sondos in Dubai and it was a most pleasant stay. We had a spartious suite with a separate bedroom. The suite as a whole is clearly five stars, even compared to other hotel rooms in Dubai. The location is perfect: Deira City centre (with Carrefour) is just across the street and the entrance to Metro station, from where you reach the central and new parts of Dubai is also just around the corner. This was really very, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money spent !”
Reviews.Author: vinn_2k
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from the 24th Dec- 01 January and got a fantastic rate considering it was the peak Xmas-Newyear period. We stayed at Room 713. Except for the floor which looked worn out and old, we loved our stay here. Large spacious rooms, big screen TV, complete kitchenette with utensils, hotplate, toaster, washing machine, cutlery, iron and iron board and more... The reception was friendly, checkin was fast ( thanks to Ariel), service was very fast when we called to replace a chair that was about to give way, or wanted a late checkout which they agreed to, or more glasses and cutlery, hailing a cab or whatever. I liked the location too, a good restaurant opposite the hotel, a nice bakery, A KFC type fast food centre called southern fried chicken besides the hotel - all with reasonable prices and 3 large supermarkets - City Mart, Choithram and the lovely spinneys.... A cab from there to most places like the Burjuman Mall, Meena Bazar etc wont cost you more than 10 Dhs. Overall a great place to stay in..... Will definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what I need”
Reviews.Author: tanawan
Reviews.Content: I offer a top rank 5 star. It is ideal for me for my business travels. Some considerations: You'll be awakened by prayer call - in stereo as there are two mosques very nearby. If you really listen, there is a third far away. It's not a resort tourist hotel. It is right on a mildly busy street, and you will hear the traffic. It's night real close to the metro. However, if you walk a couple of blocks, you can catch a bus to the metro stop. Of course, taxi is only 10 dirham. Some of the things I appreciate: Good value for the money. But - If the price was higher, I would not stay. Good washing machine and kitchen in the unit. Swimming pool is just fine. Breakfast is good in the morning. Service at the hotel is excellent. Easy to catch a taxi. Local grocery stores, pharmacies, laundry and dry cleaners, barber shop, and all sorts of small retail shops just steps away. Close to Mina Street. Internet is free in the lobby on their computers. Not a large hotel, so it is convenient. Nice fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “So Good I Kept Extending my Stay”
Reviews.Author: appraiserman
Reviews.Content: I originally chose to stay at Dar Al Sondos in order to buy some time while looking for a new apartment (and build up some Starwood SPG points!). Expecting only to stay for a month or so (the sales staff gave me a GREAT rate for month-to-month) I enjoyed my stay so much that I extended my stay for another month; then a week; then two weeks; finally ending up staying for a little more than 3 months. The furniture in the rooms is not impressive by any means, but the room is large, has all of the day-to-day appliances, and the bed is King Size. This hotel is unlike many others as the staff are genuine, anticipate guest needs, and provide service above and beyond what is requested. I am a picky traveller as hotels are my job so I know how it all works. Much effort is put in from the staff to ensure that the guest is comfortable and has everything they possibly need. A taxi for a night on the town or a trip to the airport? Ask the bellman and he'll go hail one for you. Hands full of groceries or files from work, pass through the front door and the doorman will offer a helping hand. The front desk staff are knowledgable and friendly; some even pretty cute ;-) All in all this was a terrific experience which made looking for an apartment that much easier because I always knew that I had a home at Dar Al Sondos. A hearty "thank you" to all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel excellent breakfast spread”
Reviews.Author: pravinfirasta
Reviews.Content: Dar al sondos was a good experience. we are almost 40 people & i was with my wife & two kids. kids enjoyed the stay as it was their 1st foreign trip i specially recommend their well spread breakfast with wide variety of food. swimming pool is so so but children enjoyed it service was good & friendly except reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Balfour_561
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Apt. Hotel for 3 nights after disembarking from a cruise. We were welcomed with a glass of juice and taken to our studio on the third floor. It was a large room, king bed, , sofa, kitchenette, and washing machine (no dryer). The bed was comfortable and the bathroom adequate. The hotel amenities were excellent: rooftop pool, fitness centre, sauna and best of all, a club lounge with free internet, tea, coffee and newspapers. The Concierge was friendly and helpful and the location was within walking distance to the Creek (Museum, Souqs, etc) and a nearby bus stop went to the Metro. A taxi to the Metro was only $4.00. At $70 per night, this 3 star hotel was a great bargain and we look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, great service & nice apatrtment”
Reviews.Author: lamio01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Dubai for a few days on and off. Great customer service, porters are very good as is the restaurant staff and room service. Reception staff all seemed to be trainees that knew very little. The room apartment was very clean and pacious, all mod con and kitchen area adeqate. Roof top pool wa never too full and plenty of seating with free towels. Cabs easy to get outside, except at 9am or 5pm ! Nothing reall to walk to, couple of general stores potted about, restaurant across the road and a few VERY LOUD MOSQUES at 5am - yes I know muslim country but really... tell omeone before they book the apartment. All in all very happy here

Reviews.Title: “So very disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Dor15z
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through the SPG (Sheraton) website as a prefered guest, looked great, read well. Arrived at the hotel, no assistance with our luggage, the reception staff were very good and offered me a free upgrade to a room with a balcony. Got to our room and suprise, no balcony, oh well no upgrade. Placed our bags down only to find that the room had not been cleaned from the previous guests. they offered to clean our room. The internet did not work, the beds were hard and the pillows flat. half of the utensils were missing, the shower constantly flooded the floor. I could go on and on. On the upside the pool was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pavionvacation
Reviews.Content: The place is clean and nice. Staff are friendly. Just a request if management is reading the review. Please keep updating regarding visa. Because, till u have the visa in hand, u dont have the mood to pack.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like at home with luxury”
Reviews.Author: Harsh081
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and are completely satisfied with their service. Also the room was very clean and it had all the facilities provided within. Room service was quick and were always polite and helpful. Quality of food, especially breakfast was very nice as it had lots of options and taste delicious. Hotel location is nice as it had all kind of shops nearby with variety of stuff available at very resonable price. I wuld definitely prefer to stay there again on my next visit to the dreamland-Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymakers777
Reviews.Content: I've just arrived back after staying there with my husband in July 2010 and we were pleased with the affordable price. The staff were helpful with our queries and the free internet was really useful (45 mins per day allowed). The pool was nice and cool on hot days and they provide towels for by the pool when you get up there. There are also comfortable beds and parasols to use. The location was within a short taxi journey, costing approx £4 each way, of most places we wanted to visit. As with other travellers I got taken to the wrong hotel initially - Make sure you tell the taxi drivers to go to "Rolla Street in Bur Dubai". I took a map from Google which turned out to be incorrect but when we said the address they always knew where we meant. The bus station is 7ish minutes walk away and we went to Abu Dhabi for the day (2 hour bus journey) for 15 Dirhams each way (approx. £6 return each). There are buses to many places. There is also a Carrefour store approx. 10 mins away with affordable food. The kitchen facilities are a bit minimal but when we asked them to get the missing items and also asked for a knife to cut vegetables they quickly did so. We bought a sieve and some mugs as we felt these were necessary. I'd recommend that you bring a travel washing line if you want to use the washing machine as it isn't a tumble dryer and we struggled to find places to dry our clothes. We had a free shuttle to the beach one day which was excellent as they dropped us at the beach and collected us 4 hour later. We had to book it the day before to arrange that. If you don't want to be disturbed you may have to ask for a do not disturb sign if you don't have one in your room (particularly if you have arrived on an overnight flight and want to sleep in) as the maid service is quite early at times. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Le Meridien Dar Al Sondos”
Reviews.Author: jenjentravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Meridien Residence Deira for three nigths before moving over to this property for two nights. This hotel is nice enough, but I didn't care for the area. I much preferred the Deira Creek area - it had a great vibe and I felt safer over there. I only moved to this hotel in order to meet a friend who was a tight budget, and the rooms here were significantly less (only $56/nt which is a deal in Dubai). More about the Dar Al Sondos...Ariel at the front desk was so nice and professional. He checked us into a nice, quiet room and helped us with our dinner reservations. All of the hotel staff we encountered were extremely kind and service oriented. The room/apartment was large and equipped with a kitchen, sitting area and clothes washing machine, which came in handy with 100 degree days! The room was sparkling clean and spacious. There was work on a construction site going on right outside our window, but they stopped promptly every night at six, so it didn't bother us at all. There was a mosque located next to the constructions site, so the call to prayer was in dolby stereo in our room, but I liked it! There were two free computers in the lobby for guest use. Again, the hotel was just fine for us, but I wasn't crazy about the immediate area. There was a grocery store located down the street, which was convenient for bottled water and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Jog3ee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights, our actual booking was for 3 nights but we had to extend our stay! The price was very affordable and we booked the executive rooms wid breakfast! although wen we extended we booked for standard room but they did not move us from our previously booked room! that was really nice of them and we enjoyed those extended two days in the same room. Location is nice almost in the heart of bur dubai EASY access to grocery stores and some local resturants. taxi to burjuman center for 8.50 aed, to dubai mall approx 22 aed, festival city approx 25 aed etc... the hotel staff is very polite and welcoming! overall a pleasant experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money Apartment”
Reviews.Author: BabyDubai
Reviews.Content: This hotel apartment has a great location in Rolla street where you can find many restaurants nearby. If you are a member of starwood, just quote the number & check in happens very fast as they have all the details in the system. There is an internet facility in the reception which you can use free of cost.However, the broadband at the room is very expensive. The rooms are very clean & the kitchen is equipped with all facilities. The hotel does not have many restaurants but only one coffee shop on the ground floor. The breakfast is great.There is a swimming pool which is small. The parking facility on the back side would help if you take rent-a-car. It's a value for money apartment & you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Non intrusive private space for all with a fine chef”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Long
Reviews.Content: Liked the apartment not only because of the room sizes and amenities therein like hot plates and washing machine - none of which were actually used. Their very existence allowed options - so when you spend you know you are doing it out of choice and not compulsion. The gym and small swimming pool is nothing great but good enough to keep you in shape. Incidentally there are steam bath and sauna tucked in the property. You get a lovely view of the skyline from the rooftop.including Burj Al Khalifa - the tallest man made structure in the world. A special word about the kitchen. Major hotel restaurants suffer from the problem of catering to varied tastes and causing food to lose its distinctive appeal. An exception was with the restaurant here where every food item maintained a balance without losing the taste. The price is also very reasonable and you can always try the set menu for lunch. Of course there are many dining options available around the property.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean room, but not in a tourist friendly area”
Reviews.Author: CallumLondon
Reviews.Content: I chose the Dar Al Sondos Apartments as a cheap place to stay for a three night stopover in Dubai en-route to South Africa. Although the hotel itself is clean and tidy, with helpful staff, the Dur Dubai location required a taxi trip to most of the tourst destinations such as Jumeriah Beach, Dubai Marina, Burj Khalifa tower and huge shopping malls. There are some shwarma shops (mostly frequented by immigrant labourers), Lebanese, Persian and Indian restaurants as well as a McDonalds, KFC and Spinneys Supermarket on the same street, plus the bars of the many other three star hotels nearby. The nearest Dubai metro stop (Khalid Bin Waleed) is a 15 minute walk away, but Dubai isn't very pedestrian friendly, and the heat in the warmer months can make long periods outdoors unbearable. The room provided was massive, complete with a kitchen, washing machine, sofa and coffee table. Unfortunately the appliances such as the kettle and toaster came with two-pin European plugs, despite the sockets on the walls being the square-pin British type! As other reviewers have said, there is no wi-fi in the hotel, only an expensive network cable connection. Although free Wi-Fi seems to be a rarity to Dubai, Dubai mall has free access provided you have a UAE mobile number to register for the service. If you're looking for a cheap, but clean and comfortable hotel for a short stay, and want to see the "real" Dubai rather than everything it's famous for, the Dar Al Sondos Appartments are good choice. Otherwise, I'd instead stay near the Dubai Mall on Sheikh Zayed Road or at Jumeriah Beach.

Reviews.Title: “dishounest (not as described)”
Reviews.Author: mory739
Reviews.Content: in the hotel description is says hotel has the free wifi access and safe box ,its absolutly not correct , the hotel dose not have wifi access , there is a cable wired internet in each room and is charged at 2 dirham minute which is 120 dirhams an hour equivelant of 20 pounds and hour *****wow *********** I was shocked , I wouldnt go to this hotel if I knew the hotel dosent have free internet and wifi , I am so upset as this was a very bad experience there was only 2 computers you could use to connect to internet for entire hotel but man the computers were so slow took ages to load a page I had to restart 2 times to check my mail ,also there is no safe box in hotel rooms . and the near by mosque slogan which is to loud wakes you up at 4-5 in morning . also the fridge was frosted so no ice cubes I had to call room service every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Davidone
Reviews.Content: With new new Dubai Metro now partially in service this hotel is well-placed to move around the city (nearest Metro is Khaleed bin Waleed, by the Burjuman shopping centre, 15 mins walk / short cab ride away). Clean, with friendly staff and full service (restaurant, laundry etc) you can also shop in any of the local supermarkets on Rolla St. It was my first time there and I'll certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “great service and location”
Reviews.Author: globeseekerpa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night as I was transiting through Dubai en route to India. I had never been to Dubai before and wanted a location that was somewhat central for sightseeing. I wasn't particularly interested in the beach or shopping. The hotel is small and intimate, so the service reflects that. Even though I was only there for one night I felt like all the staff knew me by name. The room was a studio suite and was huge and very comfortable, with a kitchen and living room area. The furnishings were basic and the floors were tile, but that was fine with me. My only complaint about the room was that the water in the shower never got more than just warm. The bathroom had an individual water heater that needed to be turned on prior to showering, and even though I did that the water never really got hot. The hotel is centrally located, and great for sightseeing. It's about a 15 minute walk to Dubai Creek so you can take an abra ride across to Deira. The beach areas are about 30 mins in a cab so I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a beach vacation. However the roof top pool at the hotel is very nice and has a great view. The new metro system also makes getting around convenient. The hotel isn't that close to a metro stop but you can take a quick cab ride to get there. The one thing I would advise is that if you are expecting Meridien opulence and luxury, this hotel is not for you. I don't know how it came to bear the Meridien brand but it certainly is not in league with other Meridien hotels. That being said, it was a great stay experience for me and met my needs completely, but is not a luxury property. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: rabubahamas
Reviews.Content: Good value at under 200 AED booked via spg.com for low season. Spacious apartments with all the needed amenities. But only 2 non smoking floors. Location in the heart of Bur Dubai, away from tourists, lots of restaurants around, as well as a supermarket. 10 min walk to the creek and bus station. Friendly and professional staff. Pool and gym well maintained, free internet 24hrs in lobby

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: raghav_khera
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel to stay for five nights with a friend. The experience has been very good given the location and the value delivered. The hotel is located on a busy street with various restaurants and shopping centers within the walking distance saving on time and taxi bills. The staff is helpful and the rooms are also maintained properly. Overall a very good experience especially with the kind of room rents charged. Definitely a recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Nice Option”
Reviews.Author: Huguinis
Reviews.Content: Very nice apartments. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Nice location, if you want to do a budget Dubai and stay near the expats accomodation. Bur Dubai bus station is in walking distance and from there you can go almost every where in the UAE. If you plan to do beach vacation choose another one - the beaches are not near.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: crg498
Reviews.Content: This apartment style hotel is great value in a very expensive city. An easy 10 minute walk and you were at the Creek. Bars and great restaurants were within easy walking distance as well. Taxis were not difficult to get either. The room we had was both clean and spacious. The roof-top pool was nice and had a great view. The staff work hard to please their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellel
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in an excellent location. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet has many things to choose from (fresh fruit, different kinds of bread, cheese, pastry, omelets, sausages etc.). Rooms are in good condition, with TV, washing machine, microwave, oven etc. Good beds. Only the toilet was not perfect, as we did not always get hot water. Despite that, the quality of the toilet was above the toilets of most 3 star level hotels. There was also free parking in the hotel. Note, however, that if you intend to do day trips with a car, Bur Dubai area is in the immediate center of Dubai, meaning very heavy traffic most of the time. You will spend lots of time in the car. This applies to the whole downtown Dubai (especially Deira and Bur Dubai), so all hotels in this area have the same problem. It is also very difficult to find a parking space in this area, so make sure that your hotel has free parking (like Dar al Sondos) if you intend to use a car that is (practically the only option to move from one place to another as there is no real public transportation in Dubai ). The hotel also has free internet in the lobby. I would rate the hotel ****+, not ***. Absolutely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetterPC
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood Gold Members and expected any Le Meridien to be ok! Not the case. Now, let me preface this with saying I am a bit of a diva and expect a lot from any Starwood hotel. My husband and I were spending the 2nd leg of our honeymoon in Dubai. As we were nearing the hotel, I knew we were not heading in the right direction. The building is old, it is not in the tourist section, and your view will be either construction of a parking garage or people drying laundry out of their window. The room was just short of disgusting. I am used to Sheraton Sweet Sleepers/Westin Heavenly Beds, etc so when I saw the flat, polyester, yellowing bed I really did want to vomit. No new pillows, no down comforter, no sheets without stains. The "suite" is equal to a suite at an old Holiday Inn...not the new ones. The bathroom was tiny, with a narrow tub. The TV was an old 20" set. No flat screens here. I thought everything in Dubai was supposed to be new and shiny. This, my friend, was not. The room caused my new husband and I to get in a huge fight because I asked if we could switch hotels. I went up to the pool to cool off, it is small and decent. But you would expect a roof-top pool to have a cool view...there is a 4 ft fence wrapping the roof, ruining any view you may have had. I returned to the room to find my husband had decided I was too high-maintenance and locked me out. I debated moving to the Le ROYAL Meridien or The Grovesnor House or any of the other actual NICE hotels in the Jumeriah Beach area. These were going for about $300 USD a night and would have been well worth it. The only problem was that I did not feel comfortable at all being a woman alone in the city. I had to walk down the street to change money at Western Union and felt the heavy stares on men on me. I turned my wedding ring inside out! All of the temples have loud speakers and they blast prayers to the entire city several times a day. I found this to be a bit Big Brother. The doorman was extremely nice and helpful. The desk staff was not as nice and helpful. You will need to change your money for Dubai, all prices are in their own currency. The weather was a lot cooler than we expected. It seemed to be high 60s low 70s and it rained some days. Not really beach weather. I ended up grabbing a cab and heading back to the airport. Like a previous reviewer, I was supposed to stay 5 nights, but due to this hotel, I didn't stay 1 night. I booked the next flight back to JFK, but word to the wise.....you are not allowed to go through security until 3 hours before your flight, and there are no restaurants or shops or anything on the outside. I slept on a chair for 5 hours. The flight from JFK to Dubai was nice and on a new Emirates plane. We had the row to ourselves and got free kits and all. The flight back was on an older plane and was packed. Not empty seats anywhere. I had a screaming (and kicking) baby behind me for 14 hours. The flight out was only 12 hours. If you are looking for a very budget place to stay and you are a man and you do not want a nice view or a beach, this may be ok. I, personally, was absolutely disgusted, I can't believe Le Meridien put their name on this place. It is one thing if it was a POS place next to all the things you wanted to see....but it was a POS place in the middle of the ghetto. Very very very disappointed in Le Meridien and Starwood for this one.

Reviews.Title: “A good 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: izzyscotlandScotland
Reviews.Content: My Husband lived in this Hotel for over a year and found it very clean and comfortable, not quite a home from home but it had everything he needed. I visited regularly and was on my own most of the day, i felt completely safe and the staff were always happy to help and very cheerful and tried their best to make me feel at home. i was a regular visitor to the rooftop pool, it is quite small and not a lot of loungers in the busy months but other times i had it to myself most of the day, very nicely maintained and clean. Overall the Hotel is a good 3 star hotel and if you keep that in mind you will find it very good. In my opinion Dubai Hotels are very overpriced and this one does the job nicely. Its not in the heart of the Tourist area but nicely placed to visit the Creek and the smaller malls. Taxi's are very easy to get but dont try to get one to take you over the Creek between 3.30pm and 10.pm as they just wont do it!! the traffic going that way is so busy!! the quickest way we found if you want to sample the food on the other side of the Creek is to walk to the Creek and get an Abra over. Much quicker, cheaper and a great ride!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap. And now I know why!”
Reviews.Author: mcjools
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 1 night transit of Dubai. Despite it being fairly cheap (about £90) for Dubai, I would never stay there again. The apartment has a bedroom/living room/kitchen, and an en-suite bathroom. The bedroom area was plain, with unclean bedding. The living area was equally plain, with a very uncomfortable small sofa, a coffee table and a TV (which had only 1 english-speaking channel that I could find). The kitchen and bathroom were basic but clean. I found the room unwelcoming, cold and noisy (lots of activities in the corridors at night). I found the number of locks on the inside of the door alarming. And I found my view of another building and a car park disappointing. The hotel is about 25 minutes drive away from the airport. The only positive points: the staff were welcoming, the hotel has a pool on the roof (although I didn't see it), and the price. Don't stay here - there are so many other better options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable hotel - GREAT service offered by friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: stmayo11
Reviews.Content: We did our research at Trip Advisor and saw many positive reviews of this hotel, so we booked it directly at the hotel's website. Received a great welcome upon our arrival: hot towels, fresh fruit juice and the staff was particularly friendly. Upon check-in, we received a complimentary room upgrade, which was nice. Breakfast was included in the room rate, which helped keep our food expenses lower than we anticipated. FOOD/DRINK - Don't miss the breakfast buffet. It was wonderful. Try to book a room where breakfast is included in your room rate. This will save you $, although we found local food prices to be fairly reasonable. There is also a small grocery store just 1 block away down the particularly busy street. If you have small children, pay close attn. to them as drivers here will not stop for much. NO BAR in this hotel, so alcohol is nowhere in the building. I was told that a few hotels close-by had restaurants w/ bars, but we were not that motivated to find them. 2 bottles of complimentary water provided each day, which was nice to have at the end of each days' activities upon our return. Complimentary hot snacks were also served at the end of the day. Choice was thin, but food was good. SERVICE - The service we received was a SOLID 4 star and more than made up for the 3 star facilities. They understand good service here and are most responsive to any request or call to the front desk. (Upon checkin to the room, we realized the safe was locked. After calling, maintenance arrived in under 5 minutes and fixed it.) LOCATION - Not the best location for Dubai, but taxis are so cheap, one can get anywhere inexpensively. Watch the street here, as it is quite busy. Probably not the best location if you have children, but was more than functional if you don't plan on staying in the hotel's immed. vicinity. (Our small family went to Wild Wadi and Mall of the Emirates over 2 days, so the location was not all that important to us). TAXIS ARE CHEAP, so don't let this location keep you from staying here. POOL - We used it several times. Very functional. Tiles in the pool area were not made for poolside use as they are very slick when wet. Great view from the rooftop/pool area of the Bur Dubai, when it's not too dusty. Fresh towels provided at the pool area. Again, the pool attendant was friendly and we enjoyed our quiet peaceful time relaxing and catching some sun at the pool. ROOMS - Well appointed and comfortable. We got exactly what we paid for. No surprises when we checked in. NO FUNKY HOTEL SMELL, as is often the case in so many places. The hotel's website gave us advanced notice that there was construction going on beside our hotel - We really appreciated the warning, but happy to report that they basically worked during normal work hours, so it did not inconvenience us at all. As is the case in much of Dubai, construction work is going on practically everywhere, so do not be surpised if you encounter construction noise regardless of your hotel choice in Dubai. Comfy bed, nice bathroom, but not huge. Everything was functional. No place to plug in hot water pot for coffee/tea, but this was solved with one quick call to maintenance, who promptly responded w/ in 5 minutes with a converter. OVERALL - The people make all the difference at the Dar al Sondos Hotel Apartments. As an american expat traveling w/ my wife and 4 yr. old son, this hotel was just fine for our needs. Daytime activities took us out of the hotel most of the day, and upon our return, it was more than comfortable and quite affordable. Wouldn't call it a "great deal for the money", but would say that we were generally happy with our experience based on the rate that we paid. I would recommend this hotel to western expats venturing to Dubai for their first trip, esp. if you don't want to spend a lot of $ to just get out and explore this exciting/vibrant city for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !!”
Reviews.Author: Mum_and_me
Reviews.Content: We arrived at approx 3am from Cairo and were greated with hot towels and juice at reception !!! All staff outstanding. Rooms great, all you would need for a bed for the night - you are out shopping all day !!! Laundry service excellent. Never used pool, but looked great. Breakfast included was great, again staff fantastic. I left my jacket on a chair one morning and they returned it to me the next morning (I had not even missed it yet !)

Reviews.Title: “Not Fantastic, but good”
Reviews.Author: Rees3s
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked our trip to Dubai so I'm not sure exactly how much we paid for the room but I was satisfied with the overall package price based on the features of the hotel. It is not near the beach but is close to some of the malls and other interesting areas. The staff was friendly, complimentary breakfast was satisfying. It was too cool for us to take a dip in the rooftop pool but it was clean and looked well maintained. The internet connection was a little slow. We had an amusing time trying to figure out how to use the washing machine. And found out at check out that we had never turned on our hot water. There was a light switch-type toggle on the wall that we were wondering about well...that's what it was for. If you have your window open at daybreak, you can hear the Muslim call to prayer..."Allah U Akbar". I thought it was very spiritual and soothing. My traveling parnter found it a little eerie. : ) It isn't a 5* hotel but is nice and comfortable with friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time At The Meridien Al Sondos...”
Reviews.Author: AshBash19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this accommodation with my boyfriend on the 13th October for 11 nights. We came to Dubai due to family friends having a wedding blessing at the Ritz-Carlton. I work as a Travel Agent and did some thorough searching for hotel that would suit us aswell as not spending a complete fortune (accommodation in dubai can be really expensive) especially as we were staying longer than all the guests. I found this fantastic priced hotel & checked up on TripAdvisor for all the reviews. When we eventually got to the hotel, i realised I had looked at the wrong hotel..! There was absolutely nothing to worry about, as soon as we pulled up outside the hotel, the consierge was waiting there, opened doors, took lugagge into the reception. Reception staff were so so friendly, we were handed a drink and damp towels to wipe down due to the heat. We arrived a couple of hours before the check-in time, no problem at all, got a room straight away and even upgraded to a corner apartment on floor 3. Rooms :- The apartment was fairly big, the usual essentials.. kitchenette with microwave, hob etc. Queen sized bed, air con worked very well. T.v had lot's of english/american channels. We had a problem with the shower not working, one phone call down to reception, someone was right up and sorted it within 5mins. The balconies are quite small, however, i'd rather have one that not have one at all. Location :- Meridien Al Sondos is in Bur Dubai, the more suburban area of Dubai. We did have to take taxi's to most places. Most nights we went to the Hard Rock Cafe (you must go there!!) it cost roughly 50 dirhams one way. There are restaurants and a shopping centre just down the road. Supermarkets to buy your essentials just 2 min walk. Food :- We ordered alot of Room Service and the food was gorgeous. We had breakfast included in the holiday price, we only got up twice during the stay to have breakfast as you only have a certain time to between to get it. Breakfast was okay, but we prefered the room service. Facilities :- the pool is on the roof top which is great for catching some rays. quite small but efficient. there's always someone on watch incase theres any mischief going on, or for the children. Internet connection very slow but it works! The gym is brilliant, all the new gadgets not that I done any grafting, just had a little peek. Service :- Fantastic, everyone was so helpful. If you need anything they help you out straight away. If you need a taxi, you just sit and wait and the consierge will grab one for you. Would go back here anytime, but because i've done the city side of Dubai, I might go beach side next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: RugbyboyLondon
Reviews.Content: Hi travelled to Dubai for the Rugby 7s, 3rd Time I have stayed at the Dar Al Sondos. Good location near shops, restaurants, and great helpful staff.OK its not on the beach, but because its a Le meridien you can get a shuttle to the Royal Meridien Beach Resort and Spa, and pay £15 odd to go in for the day. Transfers from the airport were great. Well worth it for the 5 star experience for a day on the beach. Near the airport for convenience, perfect for a business trip. The rooms are large , well equipped and quiet and very clean. Pool on the roof was lovely.Breakfast was also good. For the price and the location its a perfect hotel. Great tip, go to the Automatic lebanese restaurant at the end of Rolla Street, in the shopping centre food court area, next to the dates shop, best grilled lobster and giant prawns, and the cheapest, went twice, fantastic, dont forget the garlic sauce!!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Option for Beating the High Prices of Dubai”
Reviews.Author: jfoote
Reviews.Content: If visiting Dubai during the high season or a big event, the hotel prices are outrageous. In an effort to lower the costs, my wife and I stayed at Dar Al Sondos by Le Meridian, an apartment hotel. The room was booked on the Starwood website.
