The hotel is just off the river in Burj Dubai on a quiet street with small businesses. The room was an efficiency apartment with a bath, kitchen (with washer), sitting area and two twin beds. Although a small hotel, it is a full-service with a restaurant, internet station for a fee and tour desk. The upper floors are executive rooms with access to a lounge on the top floor, which also has the pool and fitness center. I was impressed with the quality of the hotel, service and location. Except for the tile floors, this equates to an upscale motel in the States. Close to the hotel is a 7/11 type store, an inexpensive chicken/pizza eatery, several laundries and a large supermarket. While not inexpensive, the Dar Al Sondos provides an option for budget travelers and businessmen seeking relief from the high prices of Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Strian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at le Meridien dar al Sondos appartments for a week in Nov 2007 while visiting our daughter who lives in Dubai. This apparthotel is owned by a local company but managed by Meridien, part of the Starwood group. Essentially it is just like an hotel, with the facilities and service you would normally expect, but with the addition of modest kitchen facilities in the rooms. It is well situated in Bur Dubai, with free secure parking if you have a hire car, or reasonably placed for passing taxis if you don't. It is a short (5 minutes) taxi ride up to Trade Centre Road from where you can get anywhere, or down to Dubai museum and the Creek, or across to Deira by the tunnel. Personally I think Bur Dubai is the best base for independent visitors to Dubai who are not looking for the luxury and cost of 5 star beach hotels. All the front of house staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a one bedroom appartment which consists of a large room, with a small kitchen area and a breakast bar at one end, a sofa and chair in the middle and a large king sized double bed at the other end of the room. It was clean and well equipped, although a little short of shelves in the wardrobes. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towls provided. We had a room on one of the executive floors so breakfast was included in the room price. The free breakfast is served (for executive rooms) on the top floor adjacent to a well equipped fitness centre and a sauna. It was excellent with a wide choice of cereals, juices, fresh fruit, cold cuts, cheese and a hot buffet. There is a restaurant on the ground floor, but we did not use it so can not comment. The hotel does not have a bar. Because we were there at the time of the Dubai air show we had to pay full rack rate, but even this we thought was good value-for-money for Dubai. Overall, we would certainly use it again and would recommend it without hestiation.

Reviews.Title: “5* for 3* Price.”
Reviews.Author: joppy1
Reviews.Content: Arrived here at 10.00a.m. checked in early with no extra charge, greeted with a cool drink, whilst luggage taken to room. Nothing too much trouble excellent stay, with a late check out for an extra half night rate. If you wanted anything they were only too pleased to oblige. There was a full hot and cold breakfast every morning The 3course special evening meal was reasonably priced with a choice of courses every night. If you wanted the shuttle bus service you just booked it the previous day. There was food and drinks available round the pool if you required it, along with free towels for the pool. All in all a very pleasant and enjoyable stay. Couldn't have been treated any better if we had been in a 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Tembas
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at a budget place that was still able to process my husband's short stay visa for Dubai. We found this place to be easily contacted and they did process the visa before we got there. They did process it incorrectly so we had to pay a fine and that was irritating, but it did get us through immigration. Requests for a refund fell on deaf ears. The room was decent but a bit smelly, like someone cooked fish in it for a week. Was it cooking smell or the cleaning solution? Hard to tell. Luckily we were there in January so it was quite cool and we could throw the window open and get the smell out. People coming in the summer would have more of an issue. The cleaning staff did a good job and we got fresh towels every day We liked the bathroom, kitchen and bed. The room had a clothes washer which was nice. There was no breakfast in our cheap price but we did all our cooking in the room which saved a lot of money. The neighborhood was working class and no one seemed to sleep around here. We could go looking for food and groceries anytime day or night. If course, crime is pretty much non-existent in this city so we felt safe walking anywhere, anytime. Just watch out for the bad drivers. The pool was nice. It is surround by a bunch of Europeans turning brown and no one seemed to actually swim. It was cold but why heat it when no one swims? Reception was nice enough. We managed to figure out the bus system so took the bus to the airport. I think the airport shuttle was no longer offered by the hotel. One couple was going to the airport on the same day and we heard them told by staff that two hours before the flight was plenty of time for calling a cab. With the hellish traffic we thought that sounded tight. Hopefully the couple made it. We would give at least an hour to drive there and two hours for the airport. We have pretty low expectations for hotels in general. We could see why this hotel would not be up to snuff for those with high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Dubai, and we keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Miriam-Nikaj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here several times over the past year. We work in Afghanistan, so due to flight limitations, we are here often. We have tired other hotels in Dubai, but keep coming back to this one. It is basic, clean, good service, not over the top (like so many other dubai hotels) but my favorite is that there is no "in house" disco to keep you up all night. This is a good place for travelers who are in Dubai for something other than party-ing all night. The room service is always excellent and there is also a great little Indian restaurant across the street. Also, there are a few small grocery stores a few meters down the street as well as a small shopping mall with a travel agent on the 2nd floor in case you need to make any travel chages. Airport drop offs are not a problem- any time, day or night. Also, there is a washing machine for clothes in the room, should you need to do a load. The little kitchen is great for making your own snacks (remember the little gorcery store down the street). All in all, it is a perfect little hotel for us- the weary traveler. Good food, cheap and clean- can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: tunjio
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and son for a week in March and we had a really enjoyable stay. The staff were quite courteous at all times and the facilities were extremely clean and well kept. I was quite surprised to hear about the unpleasant experience of some guests but this was certainly not the case with us. The standard of cleanliness was remarkable and the location was excellent for our schedule and needs as well. Breakfast was more than adequate, especially with a small child and it is well located within proximity to good supermarkets and restaurants. The only suggestion I would like to make is with the tour guide at the reception - no matter what price you get quoted, always negotiate because as I found to my cost every quote you get given is just an invitation to make offers! All in all I think it is definitely somewhere we would stay again when we do go back to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belgiumguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for ten days from the 20th till the 30th march 2007. The hotel is wonderfull and has a great staff with friendly people. The rooms are spacious and have everything needed. There was indeed some construction going on on the lot next to the hotel and we actually had a room overviewing this but that didn't bother us at all. The breakfast is wonderfull and everything at the restaurant to. The only thing that bothered me was the tour agency @ the hotel SUNCITY TOURS BEWARE OF THEM We booked four tours with them and for the last one they charged way to much and the tour was awfull. The guide didn't spoke any understandable English. The so called wonderfull lunch was inexisting and half of the tour described in the book wasn't done. The dessert safari, the dinner cruise and the city tour where very well but the east coast tour is like i mentioned very bad. That must have been the worst tour ever. So maybe it's worth looking to other tour agencies.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: ANAAYESHA
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, we stayed there for five nights from November 09 till 14. They picked up us at airport which was a pleasant surprise. Excellent staff: front desk, driver, bellboys, room service and our housekeeper who was from Nepal. The room very big and comfortable studio and the breakfast delicious. I highly recommend this hotel, Ana Teresa Delgado de Marìn Caracas, Venezuela

Reviews.Title: “Lukewarm reception!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pocolopau
Reviews.Content: recently stayed here 3 nights with my husband, no transport provided from airport, had to get taxi (approx £6) reception people were okay but not overtly friendly, was given a twin bed room, even when we had booked for a double! had to go back down and show them my copy of reservation for double room, no problems, was given a double rm which was even better as it was on the corner and had dual views of the area, white walls were grubby! however as i was going down the hallway it seemed the decorators were in some rooms revamping the whole room, paint, fittings, new colour scheme etc... a porter guy took our luggage to the room on arrival and this one in particular was overtly friendly. we thought it was just his good nature, but he was trying to hard sell us a sand safari trip costing Dhs170, lucky for us my husband picked a leaflet at the airport for the exact safari, costing Dhs160!!! obviously he was trying to get his own cut!!! we told him we will think about it, and decided to go directly to the company. incidently, the hotel was charging Dhs240 for the same tour with the same company!!! anyway to cut it short, this porter, and the hotel were really peeved of with us that we didnt go through them, and everytime we saw the porter and smiled at him he ignored us, which was just really bad manners!!! the rest of the staff are generally hard working friendly people. the rest of the hotel was ok, buffet breakfast was included in our stay price, was ok, good choice of foods. the room was ok, but a funny smell in the kitchen. being a corner room it was quite large, the bathroom was ok, tiny bath, but we did have v.hot water! towels were changed in the morning and the evening, which was great! also a nice little suprise was a saucer full of chocolate easter eggs and sweets was left on our bedside table to mark easter! also the pool was ok, great if u want to bake yourself as its on the roof directly under the sun! & can get crowded around with the decks as there not enough space, plus ...women beware, the pool guy wears dark sunglasses for a reason, and its not to protect his eyes from the sun!!! i was planning to use the pool all 3 days, but with some1 sitting and watching, is very uncomfortable so i ended up using for only 1 hour!!! the general area is good with 4 shopping malls down the main road, a supermarket to stock up on cheap fruit, water, snacks etc, a post office down the other side of the road ( to post your postcards), a phone box across the road (to phone home, and cheaper than hotel phone), plus lots of eating places around!!! also theres lots of other hotels in the area. the nice thing was a big mix of different people, workers and tourists. i dont think i'l come to this hotel again, rather try something new! Dubais a great place, this was my 3rd time, and wont be the last, and theres loads of hotels to choose from!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Dubai in Feburary for a four day break, we wanted to be central but didnt want to spend a fortune on a hotel that we were only going to use to sleep in. Although we had read the advirse comments we decided to take a chance, well the hotel was great, we arrived at 8am thinking that we would have to wait until miday for a room but no we were checked in straight away and shown up to a large room on the 6th floor, room clean with all mod cons phone, tv, washing machine, microwave, fridge two ring burner, plates, cutlery etc. Bathroom a little dated but fine. We showered and only got luke warm water, on going out told reception and found it fixed on our return. The staff were polite and helpfull, sheets changed daily, never waited more than five mins for a cab, swimming pool on roof clean and okay for a swim after a long day. We didnt eat in the hotel as we wanted to try the five star ones. Overall a great place to stay at a very good rate no flash lobby and not on the beach but what we saved on the price of the room we spent on eating out in five star hotels at breakfast and diner. A real good place to lay your head but dont expect a doorman or grand feature lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare ....stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ewropa09
Reviews.Content: A hellish experience (it is not over). Examples? How about these: + The shuttle from the airport was inexistent...took a taxi + the room i was given stinked (do not ask me what...it might disgust you) + noisy house keepers woke me up at 7 AM + the alarm blasted at 3 AM + when asked to change room i was given a room in the same conditions. + I decided to pay the extra for an "executive room", well ........when changed (for the 3rd time) it was exactly the same as the rest!!!!! except that the room had a safe wowwwww + incredibly enough i was awakened at 6 AM....a water pipe broke and flooded the 7th floor...... + my room was left without water....guess what....new change!!! + the ordeal still lives on....i have 3 more nights ahead of me......i dream of home + the breakfast is terrible + no taxis at ythe door, getting a cab is a nightmare I will NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN, AND I SERIOUSLY DOUBT TO REPEAT ON ANY LE MERIDIEN

Reviews.Title: “decent place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer222
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel along with wife stayed at this property in jan 2006. even though the name was not known to me before but i trusted the Le meredien association and booked myself. a) prices: price quoted was extremely high AED 650 plus taxes but then it was understandable becoz of exhibition going on at trade centre. b) location: its located on residential area and sometimes finding taxi in morning could be time consuming. However there are lots of grcoery stores,restaurants on same street. c) rooms: rooms were well maintained and house keeping was prompt. Rooms ervice was OK. Small kitchen in room was extrememly useful and since we stayed for 1 week, it was very useful. Houekeeping staff will also clean the dishes and plates. d) security: this was best feature of this hotel if you are staying with family. You wont find dubious people hovering around in lobby. This is very important in dubai as many hotels are frequented by hookers and we need to be careful if u stay with family. Overall, its nice decent hotel which will give u value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DonegalGirly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in september 2005. It was fantastic value for money. The hotel is located near the electronics souk area. It isn't too far from BurJuman shopping centre, although it can seem it in 40 degree heat. Taxis are readily available and are really cheap. The kitchen is well equipped and the washing machine is very helpful. Our room was very cleaned and the sheets/towels changed daily. Room service is also very good and very good value. There are supermarkets and shops nearby so buying food and supplies isn't a problem. The hotel is about 15-20 minutes to the nearest abra station (there is also a very large Carrefour supermarket there). Take an abra across the creek to the gold souk.. much better than sitting in a taxi in traffic. There is building going on beside the hotel, but, in Dubai, where isn't there building happening!! Even the 5star hotels on the beach are beside building sites. A major plus with the hotel being part of the meridian group is that you get to use the private beaches at the sister hotels. We used the Le Royal Meridian Beach Resort & Spa.. it was fantastic.. You must be staying at one of the other meridan hotels to use their facilities. In the lobby of the hotel, Net Tours have a representative to organise some activities while you are in Dubai. We booked the Dhow dinner cruise with them. The driver was 45mins late (even though he is supposed to ring the hotel and advise if he is stuck in traffic or delayed). We were not impressed with them. The cruise was fine, apart from not having air conditioning which wasn't too nice. We then booked the desert safari with Arabian Adventures, who in contrast couldn't do enough to help. Our driver was very friendly and knowledgeable. There is a fantasic little indian/chinese (yes it does both) across the road from the hotel. It is extremely well priced and the food is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and value for money”
Reviews.Author: marthag
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to UK from Australia my 15 year old son and I stopped over in Dubai in both directions. We had a great time and would definitely return. On the outward journey we stayed at Le Merdien Dar al Sondos hotel. The hotel provided free pick up from the airport and they were waiting for us once we cleared Customs. The hotel is situated in a quiet street in Bur Dubai about 20 minutes from the airport. It does not look very impressive from the outside but we found it more than met our needs. We wanted to stay somewhere reasonably priced which is quite hard to do in Dubai. The package on their website included breakfast and it was $A150 a night. Our room was large and clean with a little balcony. The best asset was a small kitchen which also had a washing machine. This was great as we had been to Bangkok before Dubai and needed to do our laundry. The hotel provided at clothes airer on request and everything dried on the balcony. The breakfast provided was good and well presented. The pool area was well kept, but the tiles were treacherously slippery underfoot, a great deal of care was needed with wet feet. The hotel provides a daily shuttle to their sister beach property. There were local supermarkets in the street as well as a bakery, shawerma shop and a good Indian restaurant. We did not find the hotel noisy except for the morning call to prayer from nearby mosque. All part of the atmosphere of being in UAE. We would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice little budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dar Al Sondos Le Meridien Bur Dubai with my wife and 1 and half year old toddler in December 2005 for a week. I had read good/ bad reviews on this property at trip advisor and other websites before the trip. However, putting my faith in the Le Meridien brand and not-so-bad reviews, we decided to stay at this hotel. I must say that our stay was quite pleasant. The rooms were nice. We had no noisy neighbours or noisy construction around.. atleast on the wing we had our apartment in... The kitchenette was extremely useful as i had a baby with me. The room service was prompt 24 hours. No horrible mattresses, no cigarette packs behind TV (i checked!),etc. The negatives would be: 1. except for CNN and one other channel, there was nothing on tv except for Arabic channels which is a problem for non Arabs.. anyways, it didn't matter as we were outside mostly. 2. The mini bar is very very expensive.. dare not touch! 3. They don't give you bottled water through room service which was quite funny, you need to tag a mineral water carton along! The good things surpassed the negatives though! I am recommending this hotel to all my friends who are budget travellers like me.. and if you have a little one .. bingo! Dubai is a wonderful to place to be in too , so people who dont stick around too much at the hotel should find this stay cheap and fulfilling.

HotelInfo.Name: Dar Al Sondos Hotel Apartments by Le Meridien
HotelInfo.Address: Bur Dubai Rolla Street, Dubai 113562, United Arab Emirates
